data.meta_description: At the National Library of Israel, you can find information on Józef Antoni Poniatowski (1763-1813), ksiaze and view a variety of items related to the topic such as manuscripts, books, archives, photographs and more. Read more at:

“Israel’s Miss Manners” Extends an Outstretched Hand

When I was about to graduate from Bezalel Academy of Art and Design, I started thinking about my final project. I decided to create a book from scratch – designing it, forming the concept, choosing the format, the fonts and the images as well as the type of paper. I even made the book cover myself

Remembering Ephraim Kishon, Israel’s Champion of Satire

World War II

World War II was the most destructive and deadly war in human history. The war officially began when Nazi Germany invaded Poland on September 1, 1939.
